text: English grammar lesson 14 in this lesson
we'll practice reporting WH questions WH
questions use WH words question words
like who what where and question words
like how they're not just single word
they can be phrases like how far how
long what kind this question words ask
for information so WH questions ask for
more information than just a yes-or-no
so are you ready to learn how to report
these questions let's begin let's start
with an example of quoted speech two
women are sitting at a table discussing
a friend's birthday one asks what did
Brian give Tracy for her birthday
who gave her those roses in each
question I've highlighted the subject
and verb in red so that you can easily
see a difference in word order WH
questions can have different word order
do you remember why unlike yes/no
questions WH questions can either have
question word order or statement word
order most WH questions will have
question word order as in our first
example what did Brian give Tracy for
her birthday the WH word is followed by
a verb plus subject if there's a helping
verb it's that helping verb that comes
before the subject did did Brian the
question words what and who can also
have statement word order this is the
case in our second example who gave her
those roses
that subject plus verb who gave in this
question the word who is our subject
it's important to understand whether we
have question word order or statement
word order
if you already have statement word order
in your question there's less work to do
fewer changes to make in reported speech
our first example is a question with
question word order we'll need to change
the statement word order in reported
speech the original question what did
Brian give Tracy for her birthday
becomes the woman asked her friend what
Brian had given Tracy for her birthday
the subject Brian comes before the verb
had given and of course our verb shifted
back to the past perfect our second
example is a question with statement
word order so we can keep this word
order in the reported statement our
original question who give Tracy those
roses becomes the woman asked her friend
who had given Tracy those roses the
subject is still followed by the verb
who had given and again our verb shifted
to the past perfect I think you're ready
for an exercise exercise listen to each
exchange report the question example
listen to Jennifer asked Sally a
question
when is your birthday my birthday is
July 21st what did they say here are
their words how can we report the
question the question word is when so we
know we're dealing with question word
order we'll have to change this to
statement word order in our verb will
have to shift back a tense the reported
statement is not complete so let's
complete it together Jennifer asked
let's insert our question word when
subject
Sally's birthday verb was Jennifer asked
when Sally's birthday was we could also
say Jennifer asked Sally when her
birthday was Sally said her birthday was
July 21st
now you try number 1 listen to Jennifer
ask Eric a question
how do you celebrate your birthday I
like to go out to dinner with my family
what did they say here are their words
how will you report the question
Jennifer asked how Eric celebrated his
birthday we could also say Jennifer
asked Eric how he celebrated his
birthday Eric said he liked to go out to
dinner with his family number to listen
to Jennifer asked Eric another question
what's the best birthday gift you ever
got oh boy probably musical instrument
saxophone what did they say
here are their words how will you report
the question
Jennifer asked what was the best
birthday gift Eric had ever got Eric
said the best gift he had ever got was
probably a saxophone
number three listen to Tim ask Jennifer
a question
you
what a dream most excited to celebrate
and probably 16 like 16 seemed very
mature what did they say
here are their words how will you report
the question
Tim asked what age Jennifer had been
most excited to celebrate Jennifer said
she had probably been most excited to
celebrate her 16th birthday
additional practice is available at
English cafe calm my username is
Jennifer ESL the follow-up exercised
this lesson is now available to follow
the direct link listed in the video
description in the next lesson we'll
finish up with reporting questions and
I'll teach you how to report questions
using infinitives and something called a
wh infinitive we'll then study how to
report commands and use other reporting
verbs that's all for now thanks for
watching and happy studies
